page.title: 03Brands Hatch and noise
page.content:
The village of{West Kingsdown}lies immediately to the south of Brands Hatch. The gardens of some houses go right to the edge of the longer, Grand Prix, circuit.
Despite the fact that most of the houses were built after the racing circuit there is considerable{local {opposition}to racing at Brands Hatch.
The chief causes of concern are{noise and{traffic.} The noise problem is not helped by the local topography which serves to funnel the sound in the direction of the local communities.
Race days are mainly at weekends and the{local authority}have fixed a{usage {constraint}that racing must cease by 8 p.m. and no activity is allowed before 9 a.m. on any day.
